intro: Hylotelephium populifolium, commonly known as the "Furrowed Stonecrop," is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It features fleshy, thick leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps it store water and survive in arid conditions. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to reddish flowers during the summer months. It is often found growing on rocky slopes or in well-drained soil, thriving in full sun. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
